instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 A1708
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have the A1708, which was liquid damaged on different parts of the board but I managed to solve those issues. I got to a point where the KB is not working and I replaced a new one since that one was flooded. The power button works fine, but the rest of the kb is not. I get PP3V3_G3H_KBD, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_4, and diode mode reading are good. 

Any suggestions, please?
Thanks :D

threads.title: 820-00840 A1708
threads.message:
Trackpad works good, only keyboard problem?
Check traces between J4801/10.
Try another trackpad flex.

threads.title: 820-00840 A1708
threads.message: Yes trackpad works fine. I will take out the trackpad maybe some liquid went inside the flex cables and revert

threads.title: 820-00840 A1708
threads.message: Trackpad issue :D Solved and thank you

threads.title: 820-00840 A1708
threads.message: Remember that KB information goes to PCH via TP...

threads.title: 820-00840 A1708
threads.message: Yes got it :D Thank you very much
